definition: agape and tongue-tied (idiom); at a loss for words/gaping and speechless
to open up/to spread/sheet of paper/classifier for flat objects, sheet/classifier for votes
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
(of a plant) to produce (fruit or seeds)/Taiwan pr. [jie2]
knot/sturdy/bond/to tie/to bind/to check out (of a hotel)

sentences.english: Even if as for is not at a loss for words, also can only be ambiguous at least.
sentences.chinese: 即使不至於張口結舌，至少也只能含含糊糊。
彼得張口結舌答不上來。

sentences.english: Even if not a loss for words, at least we can only vague.
sentences.chinese: 即使不至於張口結舌，至少也只能含含糊糊。

sentences.english: James Murdoch was left stammering by that one.
sentences.chinese: 詹姆斯默多克被這個問題問得張口結舌。

sentences.english: One might say that her opponents display a syndrome called being tongue-tied.
sentences.chinese: 也許你可以說她的對手們都變得張口結舌了。
傑克張口結舌，手足無措。

sentences.english: On hearing the news, his jaw dropped.
sentences.chinese: 聽到這個消息，他驚訝得張口結舌。
